private_information: I know the available high-level actions: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted
I have descriptions of preconditions and effects for each action as observed from the use-case
I will analyze and produce an abstract action schema set and suggestions for consistent object naming
planner.goal: Produce a clear, normalized description of actions and their preconditions and effects to help build a PDDL model

private_information: I have the initial state facts observed in the use-case
I can map object identifiers to roles and propose an object universe with type groupings
I will produce an explicit initial-state model and a canonicalized goal statement
sensor.goal: Provide a complete and normalized initial state model and canonical goal for the orchestrator

private_information: I specialize in auditing temporal and causal consistency
I will detect bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens or post-hoc penalties and recommend removals
I will validate that actions do not rely on hidden implicit tokens and will flag ambiguous or contradictory effects
auditor.goal: Audit the planner and sensor outputs for causal and temporal consistency and remove or flag bookkeeping shortcuts

private_information: I coordinate the other agents outputs and will assemble the final PDDL domain and problem
The final PDDL must be suitable for FastDownward
orchestrator.goal: Integrate inputs from planner, sensor, and auditor to produce a complete PDDL domain and problem targeting FastDownward

public_information: Available actions: paltry object_0 object_1 object_2, sip object_0 object_1 object_2, clip object_0 object_1 object_2, wretched object_0 object_1 object_2 object_3, memory object_0 object_1 object_2, tightfisted object_0 object_1 object_2
Action paltry requires hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, vase object_0 object_1, and next object_1 object_2; paltry makes next object_0 object_2 true and vase object_0 object_1 false
Action sip requires hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, next object_0 object_2, and next object_1 object_2; sip makes vase object_0 object_1 true and makes next object_0 object_2 false

Action clip requires hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, and next object_0 object_2; clip makes vase object_0 object_1 true and makes next object_0 object_2 false

Action wretched requires sneeze object_0, texture object_1, texture object_2, stupendous object_3, next object_0 object_1, collect object_1 object_3, and collect object_2 object_3; wretched makes next object_0 object_2 true and makes next object_0 object_1 false
Action memory requires cats object_0, spring object_1, spring object_2, and next object_0 object_1; memory makes next object_0 object_2 true and makes next object_0 object_1 false

Action tightfisted requires hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, and vase object_0 object_1; tightfisted makes next object_0 object_2 true and makes vase object_0 object_1 false

analyze.system_prompt: You are a domain analyst. Produce a normalized and unambiguous description of each action's parameters, preconditions, and effects. Do not emit PDDL. Focus on canonical object naming, suggested predicate typing, and disambiguations that will help a PDDL author.
analyze.prompt: Your role is planner. Use the public information and the action descriptions to produce canonical action schemas, list all parameter names and types, and note any ambiguities or missing links that need to be resolved by other agents. Output a structured analysis that can be consumed by an orchestrator.

model.system_prompt: You are a state modeler. Translate the provided initial facts into a normalized initial state representation and produce a concise canonical goal statement. Do not emit PDDL. Explicitly enumerate all objects and propose simple typing when useful.
model.prompt: Your role is sensor. Convert the environment initial facts into a normalized list of objects with inferred types and the initial true predicates. Present the goal as a single normalized predicate. Flag any collisions or naming issues.

audit.system_prompt: You are a temporal and causal auditor. Check that action effects and preconditions do not rely on bookkeeping shortcuts such as ephemeral tokens, quotas, or ad-hoc post-hoc penalties. Provide concrete edits or recommendations to remove such shortcuts and ensure causal consistency. Do not emit PDDL.
audit.prompt: Your role is auditor. Given the planner analysis and the sensor model, find temporal or causal inconsistencies and any bookkeeping devices. Recommend canonical fixes, explicit predicates to replace shortcuts, and assert whether the provided initial facts and action descriptions suffice to reach the goal.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator producing a complete PDDL domain and problem tailored for the FastDownward planner. Integrate the analysis, the state model, and the audit recommendations. Keep agent actions and responsibilities distinct and produce a single coherent domain and problem. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target the FastDownward solver and use STRIPS or ADL constructs only when necessary for FastDownward compatibility.
pddl.prompt: Your role is orchestrator. Integrate the inputs from planner, sensor, and auditor to produce a full PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that achieves the goal next object_9 object_8 from the given initial facts. Keep action names clear, preserve distinct agent-related actions if needed, and ensure no bookkeeping shortcuts remain. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
